title: Photoelectric effect - maximum K at positive plate

content.question: Metal plates <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are inside of a chamber. Plate <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has work function <math alttext="phi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ϕ</mi></math>. A battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> is connected to the plates. Light of frequency <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is incident on Plate <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Electrons with negative charge <math alttext="negative lowercase e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>e</mi></math> are ejected from Plate <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and move toward Plate <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, as shown. Which expression is equal to the maximum kinetic energy of ejected electrons immediately before the electrons reach Plate <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="h f plus phi, plus lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>
<math alttext="h f plus phi, minus lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>
<math alttext="h f minus phi, plus lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>
<math alttext="h f minus phi, minus lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="h f minus phi, plus lowercase e times script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi><mi>f</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>ϕ</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi><mi>Ɛ</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
